message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce both “figures” exactly as shown, without rotating any dictionary blocks beyond their listed orientations.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
■  Overall Count & Layers
 • There are two separate “figures.”  
 • The left figure uses 8 blocks.  
 • The right figure uses 5 blocks.  
 • In total, 13 blocks are used.

■  Left Figure (8 blocks, from bottom to top)
 1. Two yellow half‐cylinders (the “feet”) on the floor, side by side.  
 2. A blue cube (left) and an orange cube (right) behind those half‐cylinders, forming the bottom “legs.”  
 3. A long yellow rectangular block (“belt”) bridging across the front/middle.  
 4. A red arch block stacked above the cubes (torso).  
 5. A horizontal green rectangular block on top of the torso (like a green “band”).  
 6. An orange triangular wedge perched on the very top (roof shape).

■  Right Figure (5 blocks, from bottom to top)
 1. A blue cube (left) and an orange cube (right) on the floor.  
 2. A red arch block stacked above the cubes.  
 3. A horizontal green rectangular block on top.  
 4. An orange triangular wedge at the very top.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING NEEDED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching each colored shape/orientation in the target:

 • Red Arch (torso) → Block #2  
 • Blue Cube → Block #3  
 • Green Horizontal Rectangular → Block #6  
 • Orange Cube → Block #5  
 • Orange Triangular Wedge (apex up) → Block #13  
 • Yellow Horizontal Rectangular (“belt”) → Block #9  
 • Yellow Half‐Cylinder (feet) → Block #11  

Quantities required:
 • #2 appears twice (one red torso for each figure).  
 • #3 appears twice (two blue cubes total).  
 • #5 appears twice (two orange cubes total).  
 • #6 appears twice (green band for each figure).  
 • #9 appears once (the left figure’s yellow belt).  
 • #11 appears twice (the two yellow “feet” on the left figure).  
 • #13 appears twice (orange roof for each figure).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INFERRED
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible top‐to‐bottom sequence. You may group left‐figure blocks first, then right‐figure blocks:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 3    // Left figure, place blue cube (leg)
  Step2:  Move block with index 5    // Left figure, place orange cube (leg)
  Step3:  Move block with index 11   // Left figure, first yellow half‐cylinder (foot)
  Step4:  Move block with index 11   // Left figure, second yellow half‐cylinder (foot)
  Step5:  Move block with index 9    // Left figure, yellow belt
  Step6:  Move block with index 2    // Left figure, red arch torso
  Step7:  Move block with index 6    // Left figure, green horizontal block (band)
  Step8:  Move block with index 13   // Left figure, orange wedge on top

  Step9:  Move block with index 3    // Right figure, place blue cube (leg)
  Step10: Move block with index 5    // Right figure, place orange cube (leg)
  Step11: Move block with index 2    // Right figure, red arch torso
  Step12: Move block with index 6    // Right figure, green horizontal block (band)
  Step13: Move block with index 13   // Right figure, orange wedge on top
}

Following this plan and using each block exactly as shown in the dictionary (no extra rotations) will yield the two figures pictured in the target image.
